author: anmenaga
body:
Looks like we have extremely detailed logging turned on by default.
For example **every** function entry end exit for **every** function invocation.
Can repro on Raspbian 9 and Debian 9.
For example, this command:
`sudo pwsh -c "function foo {};1..100000|%{foo}"`
runs in under 30 seconds, but produces over 300MB in logs in `/var/log/messages` and `/var/log/syslog`
filled with events like this:
```
Feb 22 21:01:58 raspberrypi powershell[26000]: (v6.0.1:A:11) [Command_Lifecycle:CommandStart.Method.Informational] Command foo is Started.#012%n%nContext:%n        Severity = Informational#012        Host Name = ConsoleHost#012        Host Version = 6.0.1#012        Host ID = 9ef94068-9513-42e6-942d-46a28d09ddfb#012        Host Application = /home/pi/PS601/pwsh.dll -c function foo {};1..100000|%{foo}#012        Engine Version = 6.0.1#012        Runspace ID = 2ce73d6a-5384-405f-a77e-c62a0f636008#012        Pipeline ID = 1#012        Command Name = foo#012        Command Type = Function#012        Script Name = #012        Command Path = #012        Sequence Number = 200008#012        User = raspberrypi\root#012        Connected User = #012        Shell ID = Microsoft.PowerShell#012%n%nUser Data:%n%n
Feb 22 21:01:58 raspberrypi powershell[26000]: (v6.0.1:A:11) [Command_Lifecycle:CommandStop.Method.Informational] Command foo is Stopped.#012%n%nContext:%n        Severity = Informational#012        Host Name = ConsoleHost#012        Host Version = 6.0.1#012        Host ID = 9ef94068-9513-42e6-942d-46a28d09ddfb#012        Host Application = /home/pi/PS601/pwsh.dll -c function foo {};1..100000|%{foo}#012        Engine Version = 6.0.1#012        Runspace ID = 2ce73d6a-5384-405f-a77e-c62a0f636008#012        Pipeline ID = 1#012        Command Name = foo#012        Command Type = Function#012        Script Name = #012        Command Path = #012        Sequence Number = 200009#012        User = raspberrypi\root#012        Connected User = #012        Shell ID = Microsoft.PowerShell#012%n%nUser Data:%n%n
```
Such detailed logging runs disk out of space; this probably should Not be a default configuration.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
sudo pwsh -c "function foo {};1..100000|%{foo}"
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

reasonable size of logs

Actual behavior
---------------
over 300 MB generated in logs

Environment data
----------------
Clean installation of PowerShell v6.0.1

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1
OS                             Linux 4.9.59-v7+ #1047 SMP Sun Oct 29 12:19:23 GMT 2017
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: Detailed Informational logging results in out of disk space on Linux
